label: AB2CD6_mP20_11_e_2e_e_2e2f-001
title: Barytocalcite (BaCa(CO$_{3}$)$_{2}$) Structure
comments: BaCa(CO$_{3}$)$_{2}$ comes in a variety of crystal structures (Spahr, 2019): \begin{itemize} \item  \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2CD6_mP20_11_e_2e_e_2e2f-001}{monoclinic barytocalcite, space group $P2_1/m$ \#11} (the current structure) \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2CD6_hP30_150_e_c2d_f_3g-001}{trigonal paralstonite, space group $P321$ \#150}, \item triclinic alstonite (space group $P1$ \#1 or $P\overline{1}$ \#2) (Sartori, 1975), and \item \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC3_mC10_5_b_a_ac-001}{a new monoclinic structure, space group $C2$ \#5}, synthesized by (Spahr, 2019) and lacking the centrosymmetric character of barytocalcite. \end{itemize}
